children.value: New Items is a feature where you use a base item to create an item with added abilities.
To be clear, it's not the same as item synthesis.

• About
    • Characteristics
    • Pros and Cons
    • Creating New Items
    • Unlocking Secret Pots
    • Purchasing
    • New Items in Dungeons
  • Mechanics
    • Stats and Abilities
  • Popular Items
  • Abilities
    • Weapon
    • Shield
    • Bracelet
    • Grass
    • Scroll
    • Staff
    • Talisman
  • Cheating
The best way to enjoy both worlds is to create 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.
Simplifies tasks like leveling up allies to Lv99.
Warp to the stairs by swinging a staff to quickly dive in dungeons.
(Example: Save time when running Catstones for wishes in Inori Cave)
If too strong of an item is created and is chosen, the balance of a dungeon can be ruined.
â€» Especially for Old Road and Heavenly Lake, which don't allow carry-in items.
Once registered, a New Item can't be erased until you exceed 64 items.
If you're interested in speedrunning, New Items aren't allowed.
Insert an item into a secret pot located in the basement of Hotel Nekomaneki,
and then wait until the next day for random abilities to get added.
If you like the added abilities, take the item out.
If you don't like the added abilities, leave the item in the pot.
The abilities are added at midnight, and change each day for 7 days.
Once it reaches day 8, the item turns into Weeds.
New Items can be created from weapons, shields, bracelets, grass, staves, scrolls, and talismans.
Other categories like pots, food, arrows, rocks, and torches can't be inserted into secret pots.
New Items are automatically registered when they're taken out of a secret pot,
and up to 64 items can be registered at a time.

Registered items can't be erased, with the exception of the oldest item being erased
when you exceed the 64 item registration limit.
They appear in some dungeons that don't allow carry-in items, so they can be a balance breaker.
Therefore, it's recommended to make 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.

export const _frontmatter = {"title":"New Items","metaTitle":"New Items - Shiren the Wanderer: Tower of Fortune Wiki","metaDescription":"New Item brewing guide for Shiren the Wanderer: The Tower of Fortune and the Dice of Fate."}

val.rawMDXOutput:
/* @jsx mdx */ import { mdx } from '@mdx-js/react'; /* @jsxRuntime classic */ /* @jsx mdx */ export const _frontmatter = { "title": "New Items", "metaTitle": "New Items - Shiren the Wanderer: Tower of Fortune Wiki", "metaDescription": "New Item brewing guide for Shiren the Wanderer: The Tower of Fortune and the Dice of Fate." }; const layoutProps = { _frontmatter }; const MDXLayout = "wrapper" export default function MDXContent({ components, ...props }) { return
{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}{` `}

{`Overview`}

{`New Items is a feature where you use a base item to create an item with added abilities.`}
{`To be clear, it's not the same as item synthesis.`}

  • About
    • Characteristics
    • Pros and Cons
    • Creating New Items
    • Unlocking Secret Pots
    • Purchasing
    • New Items in Dungeons
  • Mechanics

  • Abilities
    • Weapon
    • Shield
    • Bracelet
    • Grass
    • Scroll
    • Staff
    • Talisman
  • Cheating

{`About`}

{`Characteristics`}

{`Pros and Cons`}

{`The best way to enjoy both worlds is to create 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.`}

{`Pros:`}

  • {`Easily obtain powerful items.`}
  • {`Simplifies tasks like leveling up allies to Lv99.`}
  • {`Warp to the stairs by swinging a staff to quickly dive in dungeons.`}
    {`(Example: Save time when running Catstones for wishes in Inori Cave)`}

{`Cons:`}

  • {`If too strong of an item is created and is chosen, the balance of a dungeon can be ruined.`}
  • {`â€» Especially for Old Road and Heavenly Lake, which don't allow carry-in items.`}
  • {`Once registered, a New Item can't be erased until you exceed 64 items.`}
  • {`If you're interested in speedrunning, New Items aren't allowed.`}

{`Creating New Items`}

{`Insert an item into a secret pot located in the basement of Hotel Nekomaneki,`}
{` and then wait until the next day for random abilities to get added.`}

  • {`If you like the added abilities, take the item out.`}
  • {`If you don't like the added abilities, leave the item in the pot.`}

{`The abilities are added at midnight, and change each day for 7 days.`}
{` Once it reaches day 8, the item turns into Weeds.`}

{`New Items can be created from weapons, shields, bracelets, grass, staves, scrolls, and talismans.`}
{` Other categories like pots, food, arrows, rocks, and torches can't be inserted into secret pots.`}

{`New Items are automatically registered when they're taken out of a secret pot,`}
{`and up to 64 items can be registered at a time.`}

Registered items can't be erased, with the exception of the oldest item being erased
when you exceed the 64 item registration limit.

{`They appear in some dungeons that don't allow carry-in items, so they can be a balance breaker.`}
{` Therefore, it's recommended to make 2 save files - 1 with New Items, and 1 without.`}
